body:

You also forgot Honeywell, Raytheon, Teledyne, and L3.

author: CaptainStavros
body:
I’ve been buying up DFEN anything around $10-$11 or below. All companies are government backed for the most part and have very little chance of failing especially if tensions continue to rise with this “was it made in a lab or wasn’t it” deal going on or if another country tries to take advantage of the Covid situation. 

DFEN holds Lockheed, United tech (not airline), Boeing, General Dynamics, Teledyne, L3 Harris, Northrop Grumman, Trasdigm group, Raytheon, Huntington Ingralls. Biggest holding being Lockheed, United Tech, Boeing at around 15% a piece the rest of the companies are around 5% of holdings. 

It is a 3X’s ETF and was sitting between $60-$70 before crash currently at $10 if you believe defense/aerospace will make a comeback eventually you can get good exposure through it. I don’t believe it will hit previous highs unless Boeing gets there shit as it is a larger holding but I do believe most holdings are extremely oversold and even through just buying shares you can easily net 75-100% return due to 3X’s exposure.
